Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of lotus flower in added white outline at left of sherd; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '7' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 155–86.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p.169, no. 169, pl. 34, no. 11)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 729, no. 894)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1719) (phase 2)
